summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Senior Officer Specialist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, conducted on August 20, 2019. The officer provides details about her duties, general prison procedures, and her observations and lack of specific knowledge regarding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and the circumstances surrounding his death on August 9-10, 2019.

persons.name: Natali Todd
persons.context: Present as an attorney during the FBI interview of the BOP officer.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual at MCC. The officer recalls seeing him with attorneys on the morning of August 9, 2019, and discusses general procedures related to him.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day and Attorney Visit
events.description: The officer worked as an acting Lieutenant and recalls seeing Jeffrey Epstein earlier that day (around 9am) in the attorney conference area with 3-4 attorneys. She also performed routine duties in the SHU that evening.

events.title: Epstein's Prior Suicide Attempt
events.description: The officer mentions having only heard things in passing regarding Epstein's alleged suicide attempt in July 2019.

events.title: FBI Interview of BOP Officer
events.description: A Senior Officer Specialist from MCC is interviewed by FBI agents and AUSAs at the SDNY USAO office regarding prison procedures and her knowledge of events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: The interviewed officer states she was not in the SHU when Epstein returned from his attorney conference on August 9, and she does not recall anyone talking about a phone call Epstein made that day.
The officer is not aware of how either of Epstein's cellmates were selected and does not know the specific procedures for an inmate coming off suicide watch.
The officer confirms that count paperwork is kept in the Control Center for 30 days before being shredded.
The officer's duties included making rounds in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and she recalled regular operations during her visit on the evening of August 9.
The interview was conducted under a proffer agreement in lieu of a grand jury appearance.
